content.question:
. . . "Vigilate, viri, et considite transtris;

solvite vela citi. Deus aethere missus ab alto

festinare fugam tortosque incidere funes

ecce iterum instimulat. Sequimur te, sancte deorum

(5) quisquis es, imperioque iterum paremus ovantes.

Adsis o placidusque iuves et sidera caelo

dextra feras."

In the passage above, Aeneas prepares to depart from Carthage. In a short essay, discuss what Aeneas' words reveal about his character. Be sure to refer specifically to the Latin in the passage to support your answer.

dextra feras."

In the passage above, Aeneas prepares to depart from Carthage. In a short essay, discuss what Aeneas' words reveal about his character. Be sure to refer specifically to the Latin in the passage to support your answer.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 3.A: Develop an interpretation of a Latin text.
